intro: Cymbaria, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It consists of several species, most notably Cymbaria parviflora, which is native to the southern United States. The plants are characterized by their arrow-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. They thrive in moist, shaded environments and are often found in woodland areas. Cymbaria species are typically herbaceous perennials with a rhizomatous root system.
